author: sfgate.com
title: New York Giants’ Daniel Fells facing amputation?
text:
NEW YORK — New York Giants tight end Daniel Fells remained hospitalized with methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, or MRSA, the infection that ended his season last week, and doctors have turned to a number of antibiotic treatments in an urgent attempt to curb the spread of the infection, people familiar with Fells’ treatment who were not authorized to speak on the record said Sunday.
Some of the more recently used medications appear to have helped Fells’ recovery, and NFL Network reported Sunday that doctors were hoping to save Fells’ foot from amputation.
Fells’ situation began with injuries to his toe and ankle. More than a week ago, he had a cortisone shot. A couple of days later, Fells’ wife took him to a hospital with a high fever. Doctors diagnosed an MRSA infection.
Fells, 32, has since had several operations in an attempt to eradicate the infection and speed his recovery.
Injuries: Knocked out of Sunday’s games were New England linebacker Dont’a Hightower (rib), Chicago linebacker Shea McClellin (knee), Atlanta center Mike Person (ankle sprain), New Orleans receiver Marques Colston (arm), Washington running back Matt Jones (sprained toe) and Buffalo running back Cierre Wood (knee).
